title: Tkachuk on Canada rivalry: 'There's hatred there'
content: On the eve of the Olympic gold medal game, Brady Tkachuk said for the U.S. to win its ultimate goal, his teammates will have to take down Canada, the team they both envy and despise.

title: Mayweather set to unretire after Tyson exhibition
content: Former boxing superstar Floyd Mayweather Jr. says he is unretiring and will resume his undefeated career after his planned exhibition bout against Mike Tyson.

title: Michigan, Duke top NCAA's early bracket preview
content: Michigan was the overall No. 1 seed in the NCAA tournament men's basketball selection committee's bracket preview, revealed on Saturday, followed by Duke and Arizona.

content: Yankees slugger Aaron Judge hit two homers in his spring debut Saturday as he gears up for next month's World Baseball Classic with Team USA.

title: Sources: New WNBA proposal includes housing
content: The WNBA submitted a new collective bargaining agreement proposal on Friday that would guarantee housing for all players in 2026, sources said.

title: Mazeroski, known for 1960 WS walk-off HR, dies
content: Bill Mazeroski, the Hall of Fame second baseman who won eight Gold Glove awards for his steady work in the field and the hearts of countless Pirates fans for his historic walk-off home run in Game 7 of the 1960 World Series, has died at the age of 89.

title: Klaebo 1st athlete to win 6 golds at Winter Games
content: Norway's Johannes Hoesflot Klaebo completed his historic gold medal sweep of the men's cross-country skiing events Saturday by winning his sixth race and set the record for the most golds by one athlete in a single Winter Olympics.

title: Smith-Njigba: Believe I deserve to be top-paid WR

title: Transfer rumors, news: Casemiro to join Messi or Ronaldo when he leaves Man United?
content: Manchester United midfielder Casemiro is drawing interest from Lionel Messi's Inter Miami and Cristiano Ronaldo's Al Nassr. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Who is behind wheels? In high-profile car crashes, no one seems to be 'driving'
content: In India's high-profile luxury car crashes, a recurring defence emerges: a hired driver was at the wheel. Investigations often uncover conflicting claims, with authorities relying on CCTV, eyewitnesses, and forensic evidence to establish the true driver. This pattern highlights the challenges in determining responsibility and the vulnerability of drivers in such cases.

title: Incensed Trump raises tariffs from 10% to 15% causing more trade turmoil
content: President Trump escalated global tariffs to 15% following a Supreme Court rebuff, citing Section 122 of the Trade Act to address balance-of-payments deficits. This move, driven by pique, is expected to disrupt global trade and faces potential legal challenges due to inconsistent trade balances with various nations.

title: India & Brazil sign rare earths pact, will ‚Äòwait and watch‚Äô US SC tariff order fallout
content: India and Brazil inked a critical minerals agreement and set a $30 billion trade target by 2030, aiming to build resilient supply chains and reduce dependence on China. Leaders also discussed UN reforms and technology cooperation, emphasizing Global South solidarity and shared progress.

title: 'Extraordinarily anti-American': Trump raps US Supreme Court as he wriggles through tariff verdict
content: US President Trump escalated a global tariff from 10% to 15% in response to a Supreme Court ruling that deemed his previous tariff actions illegal. The court questioned his authority to impose such duties without congressional approval. Trump stated the increase was effective immediately, targeting countries he believes have exploited the US.

title: 'Not appropriate': Congress-ally Akhilesh, other oppn leaders 'ashamed' of 'shirtless' protest
content: Opposition leaders and Congress allies have criticised the Indian Youth Congress's "semi-nude" protest at the AI Impact Summit, deeming it inappropriate and shameful on an international stage. Around 10 IYC workers were detained for raising slogans against PM Modi, wearing T-shirts with controversial slogans, sparking widespread condemnation for tarnishing the country's image.

title: What Obama said about UFO files that made Trump say 'he made a big mistake'
content: President Trump has ordered the release of government files concerning UFOs and extraterrestrial life, citing immense public interest. This follows former President Obama's remarks on the topic. While the US government acknowledges Unidentified Aerial Phenomena (UAP) are real, reports indicate no confirmed extraterrestrial origins, with many sightings attributed to mundane objects or advanced US technology.

title: Pakistan vs New Zealand called off: Is there a reserve day for Super 8 clash?
content: Persistent drizzle right after the toss -- which Pakistan won and opted to bat -- at the Premadasa stadium did not relent with umpires finally calling the match off at 9:05pm local time (15:35 GMT).

title: 'Shirtless' protest row: BJP & Congress workers clash in Indore, pelt stones - watch
content: Clashes erupted between BJP and Congress workers during a BJP protest against an Indian Youth Congress (IYC) demonstration at the India AI Impact Summit. Stone-pelting occurred, leading to police intervention and injuries. Four IYC workers were arrested and sent to police custody for investigation into a potential larger conspiracy.

title: Bezos's ex-wife's record $7.2bn donation in 2025 called 'bad donation', Musk agrees
content: Philanthropist MacKenzie Scott has donated billions rapidly, but Y Combinator CEO Garry Tan criticizes her approach, calling it "bad" due to a lack of oversight and accountability. Tan argues this "spray and pray" method can lead to mismanagement and unintended negative consequences for recipient organizations.

title: BJP will deport infiltrators in 5 yrs if it returns to power: Amit Shah
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah vowed to remove infiltrators from Assam's electoral rolls and deport them within five years if the BJP returns to power. He accused the opposition of turning infiltrators into a vote bank, claiming they encroached on vast tracts of land.

title: How can Pakistan qualify for semi-final after rain washes out PAK vs NZ?
content: The Pakistan vs New Zealand Super 8 match was washed out due to rain, with both teams sharing one point. Pakistan and New Zealand now need wins in their remaining matches to qualify for the semi-finals. Any loss could complicate their chances and force them to rely on other results, while the washout keeps the group wide open for other teams.

title: FBI warns of ATM Jackpotting incidents across America: All you need to know
content: The FBI has issued a warning about ATM jackpotting malware, like Ploutus, which allows threat actors to dispense cash by exploiting physical and software vulnerabilities.  These attacks bypass bank authorization, leading to significant financial losses.  The FBI urges organizations to implement mitigation steps and report suspicious activity.

title: Ellyse Perry makes history, becomes only Australian cricketer to achieve this feat
content: Ellyse Perry has achieved a historic milestone, becoming the first Australian woman to play 350 international cricket matches. Her remarkable career, which began at 16, now sees her among the most capped players globally. Perry's versatility is highlighted by her dual international representation in cricket and football, a feat unmatched by any other Australian woman.

title: Drake Maye net worth 2026: contract, salary and career earnings breakdown
content: How much is Drake Maye worth? Breaking down the Patriots quarterback's rookie contract, guaranteed money, college NIL earnings, and brand partnerships with Nike, Lowe's, and major companies.

title: Nasa flags possible Artemis II mission delay after rocket helium flow anomaly
content: NASA's Artemis II mission faces potential delays after engineers detected a helium flow interruption in the Space Launch System rocket's propulsion stage. This issue may necessitate rolling the rocket back to the Vehicle Assembly Building, impacting the early March launch window. The announcement follows a successful wet dress rehearsal and astronaut quarantine.

title: Magic vs Suns Feb 20 2026: injury report, status, H2H & team stats updates
content: Orlando Magic and Phoenix Suns clash Saturday with key players sidelined.  Orlando, leading the Southeast Division, faces a Suns team second in the Pacific.  With scoring threats out, expect role players and bench units to shine.  Rebounding and free-throw advantage could tip the scales for Orlando in this crucial positioning game.

title: Kamila Sellier shares hospital update after Olympic blade accident
content: Polish speed skater Kamila Sellier is recovering after a skate blade cut her face during the women‚Äôs 1500 meters quarterfinal at the Winter Olympics. She had surgery and suffered a minor fracture, according to BBC and Polsat Sports. Sellier shared a hospital photo and said she is ‚Äúdoing quite okay‚Äù as doctors continue testing her eye.

title: Travis Kelce‚Äôs fianc√©e Taylor Swift sparks Swiftie moment at Mikaela Shiffrin‚Äôs gold win
content: Mikaela Shiffrin celebrated her 2026 Winter Olympics slalom gold with Taylor Swift lyrics on Instagram, then got a 1-word comment from the pop star: ‚ÄúHISTORIC ������.‚Äù Inside how Shiffrin uses ‚ÄúRuin the Friendship‚Äù to fuel races, why Swift‚Äôs reply mattered, and how the singer keeps stealing scenes at the Winter Games with Breezy Johnson too.

title: Betting on just gold and silver for long-term wealth creation? Think again
content: A commonly asked question in the minds of investors is: where should the hard earned money be put to earn the best returns? Over a 1-year, 5-year and 10-year time period, which asset class has offered the highest returns - gold, silver or equities?

title: UP court orders FIR against Swami Avimukteshwaranand in sexual exploitation case
content: A special POCSO court in Prayagraj has ordered the police to register an FIR against Swami Avimukteshwaranand Saraswati and his disciple over sexual exploitation allegations. This directive follows a complaint filed by Ashutosh Brahmachari Maharaj. The move occurs amidst ongoing controversy surrounding Swami Avimukteshwaranand, including a recent protest over being prevented from a ritual dip at Sangam.

title: Candace Owens under fire as witness disputes Charlie Kirk shooting claims
content: Candace Owens faces backlash after Tracy Martin, a friend of Charlie Kirk‚Äôs widow Erika Kirk, rejected Owens‚Äô claim that she had prior knowledge of Kirk‚Äôs 2025 assassination. In an interview, Martin called the narrative ‚Äúmanipulative‚Äù and criticized conspiracy framing. The exchange has fueled online criticism, with many urging Owens to retract her allegations.

title: PAK vs NZ Rain Washout: Who benefits and who is in danger in Super 8s?
content: Rain washed out the Pakistan vs New Zealand Super 8 match, with both teams sharing one point, which complicates the semi-final race. Pakistan and New Zealand now need wins in their remaining matches to stay on track, as any slip-up could hurt their chances. England and Sri Lanka benefit from the open group, while Pakistan and New Zealand miss a chance to gain an early advantage in the tight Super 8 battle.

title: Ukraine strikes Russia: 11 injured as Kyiv targets Moscow's industrial site
content: Ukraine launched drone and missile strikes deep inside Russia, targeting an industrial site in Udmurtia producing ballistic missiles and a gas processing plant in Samara. The Votkinsk facility reported injuries and damage, while Russian airports temporarily suspended operations. This follows stalled peace talks and continued Russian drone attacks on Ukrainian cities.

title: Shikhar Dhawan ties knot with girlfriend Sophie Shine, pic goes viral
content: Former India cricketer Shikhar Dhawan married Sophie Shine in a private ceremony on February 21. The couple had been dating for over a year and announced their engagement in January. Wedding photos went viral after Yuzvendra Chahal shared them online. This is Dhawan‚Äôs second marriage after his 2023 separation from Ayesha Mukherjee. Despite past custody issues involving his son Zoravar, Dhawan has begun a new chapter with Sophie Shine.

title: Colombo rain: What is the cut-off time for PAK vs NZ match?
content: Rain has delayed the Pakistan vs New Zealand T20 World Cup 2026 Super 8 match in Colombo, with drizzle covering the ground. Overs will start being cut after 8:10 PM IST, and the latest start for a five-over game is 10:16 PM IST. Pakistan recalled Fakhar Zaman, while New Zealand welcomed back Mitchell Santner and Lockie Ferguson. Fans await weather updates.

title: The $170Bn question: US SC junks Trump tariffs, but who will get the refunds?
content: The Supreme Court invalidated Trump's tariffs, leaving billions in collected duties in limbo. While the administration previously promised refunds, the process remains unclear, with individual importers potentially needing to file lawsuits. This ruling, which affirmed Congress's power to tax, has left companies and countries awaiting further guidance.

title: 'Buckled, got scared': Congress says PM Modi 'sacrificed' India's dignity in US deal
content: The Congress has criticized Prime Minister Modi over the recent India-US trade deal, alleging it's an "anti-India deal" influenced by external pressures. This comes after the US Supreme Court struck down Trump's tariffs, a move the opposition claims will now subject Indian goods to a 10% tariff, contradicting the interim agreement's terms.

title: 'Will not allow Pakistan's dignity to be compromised': Mohsin Naqvi
content: PCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi backed Pakistan hockey players after they accused the PHF of abandoning them during the Australia tour. Players said they had no hotel and had to cook and clean themselves, sparking outrage. Naqvi promised full support, financial aid, and help with training, while captain Ammad Shakeel Butt‚Äôs suspension is set to be reversed. The incident exposed serious mismanagement in Pakistan hockey.

title: Hall of Famer Bill Mazeroski, Pittsburgh Pirates icon, dies at 89
content: Bill Mazeroski, the Pittsburgh Pirates legend known for his Game 7 walk-off home run in the 1960 World Series, has died at 89. A seven-time All-Star and eight-time Gold Glove winner, he played 17 seasons with the Pirates. Inducted into the Hall of Fame in 2001, he is remembered for both his defense and humility.

title: T20 World Cup: Suryakumar Yadav hints at India's XI vs South Africa in Super Eight
content: Suryakumar Yadav dismissed rumors of Sanju Samson replacing Abhishek Sharma or Tilak Varma, emphasizing confidence in the current lineup. He addressed concerns about Abhishek's form by highlighting the threat he poses to opponents. Yadav also defended Tilak Varma's cautious approach, stating it aligns with team strategy.

title: 'Why are you even here?' Indian traveller recalls the unpleasant immigration experience abroad
content: An Indian traveller's heartwarming plan to show his mother snow in Georgia turned sour due to a series of unwelcoming interactions. Despite valid US visa allowing entry, the duo faced subtle disrespect at immigration and their hotel. The experience left them feeling unwelcome, highlighting potential biases faced by travellers from the Global South.

title: 'Lured with games & gifts': UP couple gets death for sexually abusing 33 boys, selling their videos
content: A Pocso court in Banda, Uttar Pradesh, has sentenced a former government engineer and his wife to death for sexually abusing 33 boys over a decade. The couple also sold videos and pictures of their torture on the dark web. The court deemed the crimes "rarest of rare" due to the extreme trauma inflicted on the young victims.

title: Nigeria: At least 38 killed after armed 'bandits' open fire in Zamfara village
content: At least 38 people were killed in a pre-dawn attack by armed men on Dutse Dan Ajiya village in Nigeria's Zamfara State. Local authorities reported the remote village, with limited access, was besieged by 'bandits' who opened fire indiscriminately. This incident highlights the ongoing violence in the region despite military deployments.

title: ‚ÄòNoted the judgement‚Äô: Govt says India studying US top court ruling on Trump tariffs
content: India is closely examining the fallout from the US Supreme Court's decision to strike down President Trump's unilateral tariffs. Following the ruling, Trump announced a new 10% global tariff, asserting that existing national security tariffs remain. He also stated that the trade deal with India, where India pays tariffs, is unaffected.

title: 'I've best legal team': Indian-American lawyer who argued against Trump tariffs
content: Neal Katyal hailed his legal team as the "best in the world" after the US Supreme Court struck down Donald Trump's global tariffs as illegal. The ruling decisively affirmed that only Congress, not the president, possesses the authority to impose taxes on Americans, reinforcing constitutional governance and the separation of powers.

title: From Wagner to intelligence service SVR ‚Äî How Russia rewired its Africa operations
content: Russia's foreign intelligence agency, the SVR, has reportedly taken over Wagner Group's African influence operations post-Prigozhin's death. An investigation reveals the SVR now directs political and information warfare, deploying teams across numerous African nations to spread disinformation and advance Moscow's interests. This strategic shift aims to bolster Russia's presence, particularly in the Sahel region.

title: 'It is not the handsomest or strongest men who are...': Quote of the day by Aristotle
content: Aristotle, a pivotal figure in Western philosophy, moved from Plato's abstract Forms to empirical observation, influencing science, ethics, and politics. He established the Lyceum, developed logic and metaphysics, and emphasized virtue and practical wisdom for achieving eudaimonia, or human flourishing. His enduring legacy lies in making philosophy practical and accessible.

title: Trump slams US Supreme Court over ‚Äòforeign sway,‚Äô targets India-linked firms & attorneys
content: President Trump fiercely attacked the Supreme Court after it struck down his tariffs, accusing the justices of being "lapdogs for the radical left" and influenced by foreign interests. He specifically targeted Indian-American attorneys involved in the case. The ruling, a 6-3 decision, reinforced Congress's trade powers, marking a significant setback for the President's executive actions.

title: Five school teachers held in Odisha for 'raping' 13-year-old girl
content: The arrests were made after the father of the class 7 student and the district child welfare committee lodged separate complaints at the Rajkanika police station, alleging that the accused teachers had raped the minor, a senior officer said.

title: IED recovered behind police post in Amritsar
content: Police said the improvised explosive device (IED) was later defused, and an FIR was registered at the Beas police station. An investigation is underway, they added.

content: The LoP said¬†around 23,000 jobs were outsourced in J&K. ‚ÄúThis decision has shattered the dreams of thousands of unemployed youth and amounts to a betrayal,‚Äù he added.¬†

content: These simplification efforts, however, were far from simple as several Acts and government orders had to be amended accordingly to facilitate the process

content: The Minister says that after the United States, the United Kingdom, and China, India is making significant strides in the academic sphere

content: The honorary degree symbolises the highest level of academic recognition bestowed by the institution for distinguished service and professional excellence

content: IDBI Bank‚Äôs pan India home loan book size was ‚Çπ72,000 crore as on December 31, 2025. Mumbai accounted for the major chunk of these loans followed by Bengaluru with a share of ‚Çπ13,000 core, indicating a spurt in home sales

title: Kingston Engineering College near Katpadi becomes autonomous
content: D.M. Kathir Anand, college chairman and Vellore MP, urged the faculty members to continue their cooperation and collaboration in steering the college towards greater heights in its next phase of growth and development

title: Comparing separation of powers jurisprudence between India and U.S. based on recent SCOTUS ruling
content: The International Emergency Economic Powers Act‚Äôs half-century of existence has never witnessed the national emergency law being used by the Executive to such a distinct and sweeping extent

title: 900 police personnel to be deployed for TVK‚Äôs meeting in Vellore on February 23, says SP
content: For the Vellore event, the police restricted the total number of participants to 4,900 persons due to hot weather

title: Police seize 21 kg ganja at Katpadi railway station
content: Initial inquiry revealed that the suspect had bought ganja from drug peddlers in Andhra Pradesh to sell in retail to individuals and workers at key towns and industrial centres in the State

title: Estimates notwithstanding, T.N. government is hopeful of sticking to fiscal norms
content: Referring to the savings of about ‚Çπ5,710 crore in non-development expenditure, the government is optimistic about achieving the targets, which have, of course, been set in ‚Äúthe absence of new external fiscal challenges‚Äù

title: Corporators discuss summer preparedness in VMC council meeting
content: They call for steps to ensure clean and safe drinking water to residents, highlight supply of discoloured water in some areas, and stress the need to check mosquito menace; TDP and YSRCP members spar over progress of works under Nadu-Nedu

title: BJP holds nationwide demonstrations, political parties denounce Youth Congress protest at AI summit
content: The Congress party faces criticism from several quarters of the political spectrum for backing the ‚Äòshirtless‚Äô stir by Youth Congress workers at the India AI Impact Summit venue

title: Calcutta High Court cancels judicial officers‚Äô leaves to assist SIR
content: All leave, except under medical emergency, granted earlier to any judicial officer, stands cancelled till March 9, and those already on leave were directed to join their respective courts and offices by February 23

title: Tech knowledge essential for comprehensive development, says H.K. Patil
content: Dr. Patil said the animal husbandry sector forms the backbone of the rural economy, and farmers‚Äô income can be enhanced by adopting scientific methods, modern technology and animal welfare practices.

title: SIR: Thiruvananthapuram district has a little over 25.26 lakh voters
content: This number is 3.21 lakh lower compared to the October 27, 2025, list which had 28,47,907 voters, but higher by 86,083 voters compared to the draft electoral roll published on December 23, 2025

title: Need to recalibrate Union-State relations as centralisation has failed to deliver: M.K. Stalin
content: Tamil Nadu CM disseminates Part I of a report by the High-Level Committee on Union-State Relations, headed by Justice Kurian Joseph; says Centre must stay focused on national responsibilities, restore States‚Äô autonomy

title: Vice-President releases updated Constitution editions in Tamil and Gujarati
content: The release of the foundational document in regional languages coincided with International Mother Language Day marked every year on February 21

title: Protest at AI summit: court sends four Youth Congress workers to five-day police custody
content: The police claim that the aim of the custodial interrogation is to find out the ‚Äòconspiracy‚Äô behind the protest, the source of funding and place where the T-shirts worn by the accused were printed at.

content: Mr. Saraswati accused of sexually abusing two children at his ashram under the guise of ‚Äòguru seva‚Äô during the Magh Mela in Prayagraj; despite written complaints to Police Commissioner, no FIR was filed

title: Election Commission to deploy central forces in West Bengal from March 1
content: Sources at the Commission said that the early deployment of CAPF was a confidence-building measure for the electors of West Bengal

title: Karan Adani Outlines Growth Priorities As Adani Group Navigates Rapid Expansion
content: The Adani Group is strengthening its focus on national infrastructure priorities, defence-linked ecosystems and internal governance as it navigates rapid expansion, Karan Adani said on Saturday.

title: Business Leadership Is Built By People And Values, Says Karan Adani
content: The recognition truly belongs to the people who work tirelessly across the Adani Group, Karan Adani, Managing Director of Adani Ports and SEZ Limited, said on Saturday.

title: Trump Hikes Global Tariffs From 10% To 15% Day After Big Supreme Court Order
content: US President Donald Trump on Saturday raised the global tariffs from 10 per cent to 15 per cent after a big setback in Supreme Court on Friday.

title: Karnataka BJP MLA Chandru Lamani Arrested In Bribery Case
content: Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) MLA Chandru Lamani, representing the Shirahatti Assembly constituency, was caught red handed and taken into custody by the Karnataka Lokayukta on Saturday.

title: PM Modi's Pitch For Made In India Chips For Developed Nation
content: The foundation of developed India will be laid on the basis of self-reliance for which having chips made in India is very important, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said on Saturday.

title: Karan Adani Named Business Leader Of The Year At 2026 AIMA Awards. Full List Here
content: Karan Adani, Managing Director of Adani Ports & SEZ Ltd and Adani Cement Ltd, has been honoured with the Business Leader of the Year award at the 2026 Managing India Awards organised by the All India Management Association (AIMA).

title: Stopping Exodus, Finalising Allies: Priyanka Gandhi's Key Challenges In Assam
content: Former Assam Congress chief Bhupen Borah, who is set to join the BJP on Sunday, said several other leaders will also make the switch by March 8.

title: Adani Group Working To Restart F1 In Greater Noida, Says Karan Adani
content: The Adani Group is working on strategies to restart the Formula 1 motor sport at the Buddh International Circuit in Greater Noida, Karan Adani, the MD of Adani Cement said on Saturday.

title: Police Case Against UP Seer To Probe Sexual Abuse Allegations Against Him
content: A special POCSO court here on Saturday ordered the Jhunsi Police Station SHO to register an FIR against Swami Avimukteshwaranand Saraswati to investigate allegations of sexual abuse of boys.

title: Rohit Pawar Seeks Minister's Resignation Over Ajit Pawar Plane Crash
content: Rohit Pawar, nephew of former Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar, has questioned the ongoing investigation into the plane crash that killed his uncle, raising concerns about potential conflicts of interest and irregularities.

title: Born With Immobile Hands, Odisha Girl Writes Matric Exam With Foot
content: As rows of students bent over their answer sheets during the matriculation examination in Odisha's Malkangiri district, one candidate stood out, calmly writing her paper with her foot.

title: Kashmir Records Its Hottest February Day In History
content: Kashmir recorded its hottest February day on record today as temperatures soared to 21 degrees Celsius. In Srinagar, the maximum temperature was more than 11 degrees above normal - marking the warmest February day in the region's history.

title: "Fine If They Took It All": US Envoy On Israel Taking Over Middle East
content: The US ambassador to Israel, Mike Huckabee, has told podcaster Tucker Carlson that Israel has a biblical right to big portions of the Middle East and suggested it would be acceptable if the country took the entire region.

title: SIR Done In 6 states, 68 Lakh Voters Deleted In Gujarat, Highest In Country
content: The Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls has been completed across six states and Union Territories across India, with significant changes recorded in voter lists.

title: 88 Nations Adopt New Delhi Declaration, Back India's "AI For All" Vision
content: India's vision for a democratised and inclusive artificial intelligence framework has received sweeping global endorsement, with the AI Impact Summit 2026 concluding in the capital with the adoption of the New Delhi Declaration.

title: Adopted By A US War Veteran, An Iran-Born Woman Now Faces Deportation
content: A woman adopted as a toddler by an American war veteran, who he found in the 1970s in an Iranian orphanage and raised as a Christian, is being threatened with deportation to Iran.

title: Serbia, Sweden Urge Citizens To Quit Iran As Trump Mulls Strike
content: Serbia and Sweden have urged their citizens in Iran to leave the country after US President Donald Trump threatened military action over the Islamic republic's nuclear programme.

title: Ukrainian Drones Strike Industrial Site Deep Inside Russia, 11 Injured
content: Ukrainian drones struck an industrial site deep inside Russia on Saturday, which a Russian news channel said was a key state-owned missile factory.

title: The British Royal Family Faces Its Worst Crisis In 90 Years
content: King Charles III' s brother was under arrest. Police were searching two royal properties, and news commentators were endlessly discussing the details of a sex scandal with tentacles that stretched to the gates of Buckingham Palace.

title: Nearly 8% of voters removed from final electoral lists across six States and three U.T.s in SIR second phase
content: Combined number of voters in nine States and U.T.s fell from 21,45,62,215 to 19,75,33,701 after the SIR, with net deletions of 1,70,28,514 or 7.93%. Final lists of West Bengal, Uttar Pradesh, and Tamil Nadu are yet to be published

title: Number of permanent faculty in the best universities in the world is low: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah
content: Siddaramaiah went on to say that universities are becoming ‚Äòcaste dens‚Äô and efforts should be made to bring youth out of this trap

title: Hebbal-Sarjapur Metro corridor awaits nod amid design objections
content: The ‚Çπ28,405-crore Hebbal-Sarjapur line was cleared by the Karnataka Cabinet in December 2024, but requires final approval from the Centre

title: Bagalkot returning to normalcy; entry of Muthalik, Kerehalli barred for a month
content: However, as a precautionary measure, the police have beefed up security, especially around the Panka mosque and surrounding areas where the instances of violence were reported.

title: ‚ÄòChanges in stipend payment for medical interns may require further talks‚Äô
content: Public health activists and students‚Äô unions have been claiming that the interns in private medical colleges are paid less compared with their counterparts in government medical colleges

title: I am ‚Äòtargeted‚Äô, but won‚Äôt be a ‚Äòcoward‚Äô, says Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah, setting off more speculation
content: That is why, as long as I breathe, I will fight against this political conspiracy and against the politics of hatred and jealousy, says Siddaramaiah

title: Congress leader R. Reshmi joins BJP
content: She contested against Finance Minister K.N. Balagopal in the Kottarakara constituency in the 2021 State Assembly elections

title: Congress soul of nation and Congress-mukt Bharat will remain a dream: Revanth Reddy
content: Chief Minister recalls sacrifices of national leaders, says Mahatma Gandhi and Jawaharlal Nehru went to jail for the country while Indira Gandhi and Rajiv Gandhi laid down their lives for the nation; alleges that BJP was conspiring against the Congress and Gandhi family

title: Kerala SIR: 11 districts record dip in voters, three show increase
content: Thiruvananthapuram records steepest dip of 3.21 lakh voters and Malappuram shows highest increase with 2.02 lakh voters

title: EC publishes final voters list for Chhattisgarh; SC-ST and minorities‚Äô names deleted intentionally, alleges Congress
content: The Election Commission says there has been an increase of 2,34,994 voters in the final list over the draft rolls published earlier

title: UNICEF delegation to visit child rights panel in Kerala on Monday
content: The commission and UNICEF is in partnership on advocating the need to address non-communicable diseases among children in the State

title: Kerala‚Äôs Nativity card Bill moots penalties for submitting false details
content: The Kerala Nativity Card Bill is likely to be tabled in the current session of the Assembly, which will resume on Monday

title: BJYM condemns Youth Congress conduct at AI Summit
content: Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha stages protests in Ongole and Tirupati, burns Rahul Gandhi effigy over shirtless demonstration during Prime Minister Narendra Modi‚Äôs inauguration of international summit in New Delhi

title: After SIR exercise, Rajasthan publishes final electoral roll with 5.15 crore voters
content: The names of 31.36 lakh voters were removed from the electoral rolls during the SIR, which began in November 2025, says Chief Electoral Officer Naveen Mahajan; the final electoral roll depicted a net increase of 10,48,605 voters in comparison with the draft publication, reflecting a growth of 2.08%

title: Private hospital nurses stage token strike, demand ‚Çπ40,000 as minimum salary
content: Massive procession taken out in Thrissur; United Nurses Association warns of stronger protests if demand is not met

title: Man injured in kitchen blast in Malaysia airlifted to Kerala for expert medical care
content: Dhaneesh Ravi of Thiruvananthapuram sustained more than 53% burns and has been undergoing treatment in Malaysia since last December

title: Kerala government offers to pay for service of professionals during deceased organ donation procedures
content: Government has granted formal sanction for proposal and expenditure will be met from K-SOTTO‚Äôs annual budgetary allocation

title: Kerala will attain self-sufficiency in milk, egg, and meat production by 2031 : Minister
content: A new ‚Çπ80-crore facility, which will come up at Development Board farm in Kulathuppuzha, is aimed at enhancing cattle productivity through modern breeding techniques and eco-friendly practices. This will support local farmers and strengthen the State‚Äôs livestock sector.

title: Kerala‚Äôs first rubber producers‚Äô company commences manufacturing

title: Two people of Gujarati-origin face sex crime charges in US
content: two unrelated cases in the united states have brought individuals of Gujarati origin into focus in separate sex crime investigations . a motel owner was sentenced after pleading guilty in a case linked to a prostitution and drug racket . the investigations are unrelated but have drawn attention due to the serious nature of the allegations .

title: With Mike Evans declining retirement, where do he and the Bucs stand?
content: he will return in 2026 . he suffered three broken vertebrae in his neck during a preseason game . the Bucs' all-time leading scorer was enduring one of the lowest and loneliest points of his life .

title: 7 CRPF personnel injured in Srinagar as vehicle plunges into canal
content: a CRPF vehicle plunged into a canal in Ahmad Nagar, in Srinagar . the driver allegedly lost control of the vehicle, which skidded off the road . a suspicious object was detected and neutralised in Ganderbal .

title: Indian man convicted of raping woman after luring her to hotel with promise of work
content: man convicted of rape, attempted raping, assault by penetration, sexual assault and common assault . he posed on WhatsApp as a woman offering work and asked her to meet at a hotel in paddington . she would be helping look after a sportsman with injuries .

title: Trumpiana: Do today, die another day!
content: the don always finds a way to have the last say Presidents usually have to wait for long years after leaving office . for Gerald Ford it took 22 years, according to AP report . but the present occupant of the white house has no time for such annoying niceties .

title: X factors, key players to watch and picks for USA-Canada

title: 'Like landing on the moon': How Milner set a near-unbreakable Premier League record

title: 1 in 7 stroke patients in India under 45 years
content: Anuja Jaiswal is a Senior Assistant Editor at The Times of India, with an impressive 18-year career in narrative journalism. She specializes in health and heritage reporting, expertly simplifying complex health information to make it engaging and understandable for readers. Her deep dives into heritage topics are well-researched, resulting in captivating narratives that resonate with her audience. Over the years, she has worked in Chandigarh, Chhattisgarh and West UP, gaining diverse on-ground experience that shapes her storytelling. Read More

title: Bomb threats, pollution alerts and online classes: The new holiday calendar in schools
content: the modern-day school life has a new form of rainy holiday . books have given way to tablets, chalkboards to smart boards . the much-anticipated rainy-day ‚Äúchutti‚Äù has been replaced by pollution-triggered online classes and bomb threat evacuations .
